description:
《英乐天天唱》是一档模仿唱歌类节目，目的在于提升大家的英语口语能力。主持人会在每期节目中选取好听的歌曲片段，并给出发音提示和模仿示例。喜欢听音乐的童鞋可要积极参与哦！去沪江部落订阅本节目！

《Just Dance》为Lady GaGa与Colby O'Donis所演唱的单曲。由GaGa和RedOne共同撰写，RedOne制作完成，收录在Lady GaGa的第一张录音室专辑《The Fame》中。也成为GaGa第一首在美国公告牌夺冠的单曲！

A red one
Convict
Gaga
I've had a little bit too much
All of the people start to rush.
(Start to rush by)
How does he twist the dance?
Can't find my drink or man.
Where are my keys, I lost my phone.
What's go-ing out on the floor?
I love this record baby, but I can't see straight anymore.
Keep it cool what's the name of this club?
I can't remember but it's alright, alright.

Just dance. Gunna be okay.
Da-doo-doo-doo
Just dance. Spin that record babe.
Da-doo-doo-doo
Just dance. Gunna be okay.
Duh-duh-duh-duh
Dance. Dance. Dance. Ju-just dance.

讲解：

模唱： 

想要得到主持人专业的点评和意见吗？快来节目现场一试身手吧>>

title: 英文歌曲天天唱：Just Dance

description:
First though, the getting of film knowledge, something that oddly doesn't get easier even as communication proliferates. Time was many people, like me, learned about film not in college, but from rep cinemas. And it was an education that was catholic and all patchy, according to the prejudices of the cinema manager, from classics to the disreputable, to the banned. Those cinemas have now all but disappeared. They're replaced, if at all, by small clubs showing movies once a week or once a month, could be in a pub, library or small screening room. One of those societies is A Nos Amours set up by filmmakers Adam Roberts and Joanna Hogg, who's director of Unrelated and Exhibition. But A Nos Amours is about to go wider with its next offering showing across England and also in Scotland for one day only. Thanks to a deal struck with the Picturehouse chain of cinemas, the film on for next Tuesday is a staple of rep cinema, Chantal Akerman's debut, Je, tu, il, elle. I asked Adam and Joanna why they set up A Nos Amours.

"Well, it began in a very small, intimate way. It was a conversation with Adam and I about the films that we were watching. And it so happened. We were watching films generally on our own, in our respective homes, and so we met and then we've met in the NFT and we were talking about, well, why, why are we doing this on our own? Wouldn't it be more fun to watch these films together? And then, from that springboard that the idea of actually watching films chosen by ourselves, we thought it was important that the films should be chosen by filmmakers. We wanted, we were interested in watching films that we wanted to see. And then it's grown from there." 

声明：音视频均来自互联网链接，仅供学习使用。本网站自身不存储、控制、修改被链接的内容。“沪江英语”高度重视知识产权保护。当如发现本网站发布的信息包含有侵犯其著作权的链接内容时，请联系我们，我们将依法采取措施移除相关内容或屏蔽相关链接。>>零基础直达流利生活口语班<<
